flawed_nl_solution:
He has 25% of his take-home pay automatically enrolled into his 401k so that's 0.25*1120 = $<<0.25*1120=280>>280
His take-home pay is $1120.00 and $280.00 is taken out for retirement so that leaves 1120-280 = $<<1120-280=480>>480
They also take $100.00 out of his paycheck for taxes so his paycheck will be issued for 480-100 = $<<480-100=380>>380
#### 380

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 840, not 480. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
